page.title: 02Around the Stone Cross,Talke
page.content: We set off.First we walked up Swan Bank jotting down the names of houses. Our first stop was the stone cross built in 1253 AD and re-erected in 1887 AD.Mr Williams,our teacher,told us to sketch this.Debra took a photograph of Sidebottom's farm and St Martin's Church.Tara drew a George V1 post box. When we had done our work there we walked to the library where Simon and Nathan questioned the two librarians who were pleased to see us.There we saw one of our teacher's fathers,Mr Baskerville.We set off again and walked slowly because it was a very hot day.We sat on the green and sketched the Oasis,a public house and then met a pigeon enthusiast on Coalpit Hill.
